results.title: Concerto for orchestra
results.creator_credit: Robert Parker, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The life and work of members of the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and its resident conductor, Dean Dixon, the off-duty hobbies and pastimes of members of the orchestra, ranging from surf fishing and motor racing to violin making and chess. Highlight is an invitation by the conductor to kindergarten children to play the instrument of their choice. Features music of Bela Bartok.

results.title: The Concert (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claude Chagrin, Mark O'Connor and Black-And-White Color Film
results.brief_description: The film debut of comic artist Julian Chagrin. Filmed in Technicolour in London, we see the performing artist’s arrival at the Royal Albert Hall. He gives an impromptu and unusual performance before a delighted crowd, establishing himself as a master of his chosen instrument - a pedestrian crossing.

results.title: A Conceptual approach to teaching
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith, Education Dept of South Australia and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The problems presented by what is popularly called “the information explosion” are no more keenly felt than by teachers and students. This film appraises current teaching methodology and provides a basis for discussion to provoke new thoughts and ideas on teaching techniques. Designed as an in-service aid for re-assessing and re-evaluating teaching programs and methodologies and provide a starting point for curriculum development.

results.title: The Concept and principles of functional drafting
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Majestic Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to the new person “on the board” as well as the experienced draftsman or designer, what functional drafting can do, mentioning saving in time and cost and improvement in actual drawings. Points out the advantages and some examples of functional drafting. States the basic principles involved in this simplified form of drafting.

results.title: Con motto
results.brief_description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.

results.title: Computers in the seventies
results.brief_description: This film takes a pre-micro-chip look at computer development to the 1970s providing a short historical background and then examining contemporary computer development in meteorology, records storage, aviation and building design, and medical procedures. Touches on contemporary times with “suspicion”.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: David Stiven, Sam Lipski and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
Discusses the devleopment and increasing use of computers in Australia. Banks, the TAB, the stock exchange, aviation companies and many government social service departments are extensively computerised. Computers have an invaluable application in medical research and hospital services, and road traffic control. Presents the problem of redundant workers in a computerised community and questions the morality of a National Data Bank.

results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: A Computer glossary, or, coming to terms with the data processing machine
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Bill Lightfield, Richard Spies and IBM
results.brief_description: Beginning with a journey along a computer data path, this films uses a variety of visual techniques to illustrate terms such as software, program, flow, subroutine, mnemonic, language, boolean logic, nanosecond, simulation, pattern recognition and algorithm. Emphasises the challenge of computer programming that emerges from its precisely defined procedures. Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Bill Lightfield, Richard Spies and IBM

results.title: Compulsive car thief
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: Presents the case history of a 21-year-old prison inmate who has been stealing cars and getting caught since he was 10 years old, pointing out that his behaviour has continued to baffle his parents, and the court. Poses the question: is the psychopath a medical or legal problem?
